business-schedule.title: Business for the period ending on Monday 1 March 2010
business-schedule.division-heading: Business for the period ending on Monday 1 March 2010
business-schedule.division-note: Includes the business announced by the Leader of the House (which may be changed up to the rising of the House on the day before it is to be taken and is therefore provisional).

business-item.title: Questions to the Secretary of State for the Home Department, including Topical Questions.
Consideration of an Allocation of Time Motion.
All stages of the Terrorist Asset-Freezing (Temporary Provisions) Bill.
At the end of the sitting: Adjournment: Susan Kramer: Kingston Hospital.
Questions to the Secretary of State for Justice, including Topical Questions.

Presentation of Bill: Mr Martin Caton: Climate Change (Sectoral Targets): Bill to set targets relating to energy generation and consumption; to make provision for the sectoral targets to be met; and for connected purposes.

business-item.motion: Environmental Protection (Fly-tipping Reporting): That leave be given to bring in a Bill to require local authorities to supply regular data to the Environment Agency on their response time to incidents of fly-tipping; and for connected purposes.

business-item.title: Motion to approve a Money Resolution on the Constitutional Reform and Governance Bill.
Consideration in Committee of the Constitutional Reform and Governance Bill (Day 6).
If necessary Consideration of Lords Amendments.
At the end of the sitting: Adjournment: Colin Challen: Effect of climate change on Bangladesh.
Questions to the Secretary of State for Wales and to the Prime Minister.

business-item.motion: Water Tariffs: That leave be given to bring in a Bill to require the Secretary of State to review and report to Parliament on the current level of water poverty by local government area; to require water and sewerage companies to offer a social tariff to all customers within the water poverty threshold; to require the Office of Water Services to set common tariff levels for all water and sewerage companies; to require water and sewerage companies to contribute to an Infrastructure Investment Fund; and for connected purposes.

business-item.title: If necessary Consideration of Lords Amendments.
Motion on Section 5 of the European Communities (Amendment) Act 1993.
Motion to approve a Resolution relating to the House of Commons Disqualification Act.
Motion to approve an instruction relating to the Crime and Security Bill.
If necessary Consideration of Lords Amendments.
At the end of the sitting: Adjournment: Alistair Burt: Yarl’s Wood Immigration Removal Centre.
Questions to the Secretary of State for Defence, including Topical Questions.
General debate on the Report from the House of Commons Reform Committee on ‘Rebuilding the House’.
At the end of the sitting: Adjournment: Subject to be announced.
Questions to the Secretary of State for Health, including Topical Questions.

business-item.motion: Statutory Instruments Act 1946 (Amendment): That leave be given to bring in a Bill to amend the Statutory Instruments Act 1946.

business-item.title: Remaining stages of the Children, Schools and Families Bill.
At the end of the sitting: Adjournment: Subject to be announced.
Questions to the Secretary of State for Scotland and to the Prime Minister.

business-item.motion: Public Bodies (Procurement of Seafood): That leave be given to bring in a Bill to require public bodies to purchase only those seafood species and stocks that are demonstrably sustainable; and for connected purposes.

business-day.future-business-note: Mr David Drew has withdrawn his notice of motion that leave be given to bring in a Bill to amend the Statutory Instruments Act 1946.

business-item.title: Remaining stages of the Energy Bill.
At the end of the sitting: Adjournment: Subject to be announced.
Questions to the Secretary of State for Energy and Climate Change, including Topical Questions.
General debate on Welsh Affairs.
At the end of the sitting: Adjournment: Subject to be announced.
Private Members’ Bills

private-members-bill.item-heading: DEBT RELIEF (DEVELOPING COUNTRIES) BILL: Second Reading.
SUSTAINABLE COMMUNITIES ACT 2007 (AMENDMENT) BILL: Second Reading.
EUROPEAN UNION MEMBERSHIP (REFERENDUM) BILL: Second Reading.
LAND USE (GARDENS PROTECTION ETC) BILL: Second Reading.
BRITISH MUSEUM ACT 1963 (AMENDMENT) BILL: Second Reading.
VIDEO RECORDINGS (EXEMPTION FROM CLASSIFICATION) BILL: Second Reading.
TOWN AND COUNTRY PLANNING ACT 1990 (AMENDMENT) BILL: Adjourned Debate on Second Reading [29 January].
private-members-bill.motion-text: And a Motion being made, and the Question being proposed, That the Bill be now read a second time.

private-members-bill.item-heading: DEVELOPMENT ON FLOOD PLAINS (ENVIRONMENT AGENCY POWERS) BILL: Second Reading.

business-item.title: At the end of the sitting: Adjournment: Subject to be announced.
Questions to the Secretary of State for Culture, Media and Sport, including Topical Questions, and to the Minister for the Olympics.
Opposition Day [half day] (4th allotted day). There will be a debate on an Opposition Motion. Subject to be announced.
Motion relating to the draft Prevention of Terrorism Act 2005 (Continuance in Force of sections 1 to 9) Order 2010.
Motion relating to the draft Social Security Benefits Up-rating Order 2010.
At the end of the sitting: Adjournment: Subject to be announced.

forthcoming-debates.forthcoming-debates-heading: FORTHCOMING END OF DAY ADJOURNMENT DEBATES
forthcoming-debates.notice: Applications should be made in writing to Mr Speaker to reach his office by 7 p.m. or rise of the House, whichever is the earlier, on Wednesday 10 February. The Ballot will take place on Thursday 11 February.
